questions.question:
Rank the species below in order of increasing nucleophilicity in hydroxylic solvents:
a) CH₃COO⁻
b) CH₃S⁻
c) OH⁻
d) H₂O

explanations.a: This option implies CH₃S⁻ is the most nucleophilic, which is generally true in protic solvents.
explanations.b: This option suggests water is the least nucleophilic.
explanations.c: Incorrect order; H₂O is generally less nucleophilic than OH⁻.
explanations.d: Incorrect; CH₃COO⁻ is less nucleophilic than CH₃S⁻ or OH⁻.

questions.question: Which of the following compounds is most nucleophilic?

explanations.a: Methanol has lone pairs but is less nucleophilic due to hydrogen bonding.
explanations.b: Acetic acid is weakly nucleophilic due to resonance stabilization.
explanations.c: Methane is not nucleophilic; it lacks lone pairs.
explanations.d: Water is more nucleophilic than alcohol in many cases due to less steric hindrance.
